intro: Pilosella septentrionalis, commonly known as northern pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Its leaves are gray-green and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are small and white, often arranged in a compact cluster, and bloom in the summer months.
